BdE ggplot2 theme

Source: R/theme_tidybde.R
theme_tidybde.Rd

A custom ggplot2 theme based on the publications of BdE.

Usage

theme_tidybde(...)

Arguments

...

Ignored.

Value

A ggplot2::theme().

See also

ggplot2::theme()

Other bde_plot: bde_pals, scales_bde

Examples

# \donttest{
library(tidyverse)
#> ── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.2 ──
#> ✔ tibble  3.1.8      ✔ dplyr   1.0.10
#> ✔ tidyr   1.2.1      ✔ stringr 1.4.1 
#> ✔ readr   2.1.3      ✔ forcats 0.5.2 
#> ✔ purrr   0.3.5      
#> ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
#> ✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
#> ✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()

series_TC <- bde_series_full_load("TC_1_1.csv")

# If download was OK then plot
if (nrow(series_TC) > 0) {
  series_TC <- series_TC[c(1, 2)]

  series_TC_pivot <- series_TC %>%
    filter(
      Date >= "2020-01-01" & Date <= "2020-12-31",
      !is.na(series_TC[[2]])
    )

  names(series_TC_pivot) <- c("x", "y")

  ggplot(series_TC_pivot, aes(x = x, y = y)) +
    geom_line(size = 0.8, color = bde_vivid_pal()(1)) +
    labs(
      title = "Title",
      subtitle = "Some metric",
      caption = "Bank of Spain"
    ) +
    theme_tidybde()
}
#> Warning: Using `size` aesthetic for lines was deprecated in ggplot2 3.4.0.
#> ℹ Please use `linewidth` instead.

# }

About tidyBdE

Developed by Diego H. Herrero.

Part of the rOpenSpain project.

About rOpenSpain

rOpenSpain is a community of R enthusiasts whose ultimate goal is to create high-quality R packages for data mining public Spanish open sources.

Site built with pkgdown 2.0.6.

Template rostemplate by dieghernan, based on Bootstrapious.
